snippet.textDisplay:
On the Playstation version of "Soul Edge" (original Japanese version), each character had three musical themes, the original arcade music, an arranged version of the arcade music and a Khan Super Session track which you can hear in this video, "A Continental Gale" was Rock's theme.

Most of the Khan Super Session tracks were done by live performing musicians, hence the great sounding quality.
snippet.textOriginal:
On the Playstation version of "Soul Edge" (original Japanese version), each character had three musical themes, the original arcade music, an arranged version of the arcade music and a Khan Super Session track which you can hear in this video, "A Continental Gale" was Rock's theme.

Most of the Khan Super Session tracks were done by live performing musicians, hence the great sounding quality.

snippet.textDisplay: There were some balance issues in DOA series, even in the latest installment. certain characters have a ridiculous advantage. I overlooked it though, because it doesn't make them unbeatable, its just something you have to be mindful of when versing them. DOA 4 online would have been a lot better if it had more content. SC4 was a major online disappointment for me. The game play speed has been knocked down a peg or three, making it less responsive than DOA4. :(
snippet.textOriginal: There were some balance issues in DOA series, even in the latest installment. certain characters have a ridiculous advantage. I overlooked it though, because it doesn't make them unbeatable, its just something you have to be mindful of when versing them. DOA 4 online would have been a lot better if it had more content. SC4 was a major online disappointment for me. The game play speed has been knocked down a peg or three, making it less responsive than DOA4. :(

snippet.textDisplay: maybe I was too quick to discredit SC3. It was a good fighting game but not as solid as it could have been. the major draw for me was the create a character mode but beyond that innovation was lacking. The music added a little content to the fights but nothing memorable. It was like namco was trying too hard to make a sale and neglected the beauty and substance of the original game.  Just my opinion. admittedly when it first came out I was pretty excited until the newness wore off.
snippet.textOriginal: maybe I was too quick to discredit SC3. It was a good fighting game but not as solid as it could have been. the major draw for me was the create a character mode but beyond that innovation was lacking. The music added a little content to the fights but nothing memorable. It was like namco was trying too hard to make a sale and neglected the beauty and substance of the original game.  Just my opinion. admittedly when it first came out I was pretty excited until the newness wore off.

snippet.textDisplay: and i really dnt think SC3 was bad at all...music wise or gameplay wise....SC4 should of came out in at least another yr before they came out with it because to me it just seem it was still in the concept stage....at least with SC3 all of their ideas were fully developed and the gameplay was pretty solid...tales of the souls was also enjoyable for me....if anything SC4 would seem like the worst out of the series
